titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction bills of sale 1977.569
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-01-12T10:51-0500

did.unittitle: Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction bills of sale
did.abstract: Bills of sale for plots of land in the town of Jamaica, Queens County sold by the Queens County Treasurer's Office at public auction. The land had formerly belonged to Silas Butler but was seized due to Butler's failure to pay taxes. The bills are signed by George Bergen, Treasurer of Queens County, and dated 1875.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of George and Marjorie North Finkeldey, 1968.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County Treasurer's Office land auction bills of sale, 1977.569, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
